review_text:
Reviews are very important to me. Especially when I am going out of town and deciding where to stay and what to eat, so I do read a lot of them and put a lot of thought into the ones I write as well.
I would like to start off by saying that Beatriz was extremely helpful and communicated very well with me. She was very quick to respond to my messages and I really appreciate that.
This house is beautiful and in a great location when you first drive up and go inside. I read all of the great reviews of the quiet neighborhood and how clean the house was. So I had high hopes. I am sure the pool is a big selling point of this house, especially during the summertime. It was over 100 each day we were here, so the pool was great.
I will start with the location. The neighborhood is gorgeous and it was close to shopping, food and the baseball field we had to get to every day. However, it wasn't all that quiet. If you are a light sleeper, you might want to rethink this house. There is a very loud train, complete with whistles close by that seems to pass once every hour or so including during the middle of the night. I was woken up many times during my 3 night stay by this train. If that doesn't bother you, then location and noise won't be a problem.
A big issue with the house would have to be the locked A/C. While she was quick to lower the temp when I messaged her and she did ask what I would like it to be set at. Me and my daughter were extremely uncomfortable during the night. It was set to about 75 the whole time and didn't go lower then 73. At night it was much to hot, and I wasn't about to message her at 2 in the morning to lower it. The A/C is something that you kind of need to be able to adjust to see what is comfortable. I understand the idea of energy saving and have no problem with that, but having to ask to have that adjusted seems a bit outrageous.
The pool was gorgeous and welcome in the heat but plan to take the time to clean it each time you get in. There are two large palm trees above the pool that continuously drop pods and things in the pool all day. If that doesn't bother you then don't worry about it but there was quite a bit. There was a automatic pool cleaner that seemed to get quite a bit sucked up, but you could see a lot of pods collected on the bottom of the pool all the time.
I don't recommend walking around barefoot. The wood floor, especially in the living room, has a lot of spots where the planks are separating from each other and sinking in and will easily pinch feet.
The water in the kitchen faucet got lukewarm at best, making me wonder how clean the dishes could possibly get.
My biggest issue was probably the fact that we found 2 cockroaches on two nights in a row. I did alert her and she offered to have someone come that day but we were leaving the next day and not home at the time. So I do appreciate her offering. We shook all of our things out and checked them well before putting them in our car because that is definitely something I do not want to bring home with me.
The problem with this is that she has guests leaving at 10 and checking in at 3 and that is not enough time to have a house completely fumigated to make sure that the problem has been fixed. I understand wanting quick turnaround to maximize profit but it might be better to give yourself a day in between stays to address things this important and to make sure the house is as clean as it should be. If I were the guests coming in today after my checkout I would be upset to know something like this.
There was also piles of hair stuck under the wall in the master bedroom and the light fixture in the guest bathroom was filled with dead bugs.
I really didn't want to leave such a negative review but it seemed each day things kept piling up. The house is beautiful when you walk in and I appreciated the space and being able to cook my kids breakfast each morning. I hope the time is taken to address the issues. In such hot weather, pests thrive, so it is extremely important to make it as clean as possible each time. This is another reason that A/C is important.
I appreciated the kitchen utensils and very nice refrigerator and stove. The firepit was also really great for s'mores. There is only one small TV in the living room, so I brought a small one. With 2 teenage boys, my daughter and me we weren't going to agree on something to watch.
I really do think this house has a lot of potential and we did enjoy the family time out of town but it was nice to get back to the 75 degree weather on the central coast.
